meanings.definition: To make (an instrument) lower in pitch by adjusting the tension of the strings.
meanings.sent1: I detune my guitar to play along with the song.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally detuned the piano while trying to tune it.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked across the piano and managed to detune it in a jazzy way.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to detune the strings of the violin.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to detune the guitar slightly to fix a buzzing sound.

meanings.definition: To cause (something) to be less in tune or harmony.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site can detune my concentration.
meanings.sent2: His off-key singing detuned the harmony of the choir performance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to detune the peaceful atmosphere with its antics.
meanings.sent4: The argument between the siblings detuned the family dinner.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in weather detuned the perfect picnic plan.
